loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсун родилась в селе Орке, что на юге Кыргызстана. Мать шестерых детей - двух сыновей и четвырых дочерей.  Турсун 53 года, Турсун родилась в простой семье фермера. Она с детства помогала маме по хозяйству и любила заниматься домашними хлопотами. После окончания школы устроилась в местном колхозе в качестве лобаранта молочной продукции. После развала СССР и распада коллективных хозяйств, Турсун вместе с мужем начали заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 kGS. Сейчас в хозяйстве Турсун имеются 2 коровы. Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Турсун обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на приобретения одной дойной коровы для увеличения доходов от реализации молочных изделий. За счет доходов, она планирует дальнейшее расширение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Tursun was born in the village Orke, which is in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is the mother of six children - two sons and four daughters. Tursun is 53 years old, and she was born into a simple farmer's family. Since childhood she helped her mother with the household and loved doing household chores. 

After finishing school she got a job at a local collective farm as a laboratory assistant for dairy products. After the collapse of the Soviet Union and the dissolution of collective farms, Tursun and her husband started working with livestock breeding. They started this business with 5,000 som (KGS). Currently Tursun has two cows on her farm. 

To further increase the number of livestock, Tursun turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a dairy cow. This will increase the income from the sale of dairy products. With the income, she plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Bokhodir

texts.ru: Боходиру 43 года. У него жена и пятеро детей. Боходир опытный дехканин. Он занимается земледелием в течение 12 лет и в основном выращивает хлопок. Боходир запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Он хочет получить богатый урожай хлопка и за счет прибыли улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Bokhodir is 43 years old. He has a wife and five children. Bokhodir is an experienced farmer. He has worked with farming for a period of 12 years, and especially with growing cotton. 

Bokhodir requests a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. He would like to receive a good harvest and with this income improve the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers for cotton cultivation

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Elizabeth aumentó sus ventas, fidelizó a sus clientes y mejoró la utilidad de sus ventas y esto fue gracias a su credikiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará ropa, calzado, y artículos variados por solicitud de su clientela. Ella pide a sus financiadores que sigan apoyando a la clase productiva y que inviertan en nuevos proyectos, pues con su ayuda logró aumentar sus ventas y obtener una mayor rentabilidad que finalmente beneficia a su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth increased her sales, made loyal customers and improved the profits on her sales thanks to the previous loan she received from Kiva. 

Today, she is requesting a new loan to buy clothing, shoes and other items requested by her customers. She asks her financial backers to continue supporting producers, and that they invest in new projects, because with their help she managed to increase her sales and profitability, which benefits her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Faez

texts.en:
Faez is 42 years old, married, and has three children.  He is from Iraq and is the only provider of the family. Faez owns a small shop selling spare parts for various types of cars. He established his business in 2010 and has one employee. He has good experience in the field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Faez is requesting a loan for $2,400, which he will use to install a display window, a rolling shutter, and a sign for his shop. He wants to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a display window, a rolling shutter, and a sign for his shop.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, и имеет достаточного опыта по животноводству и выращивания сельхоз культур. После занятий в школе работала на поле, чтобы заработать деньги и помогать родителям. В основном Мехринисо выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу и другие сельхоз продукты. Более 6 месяцев она самостоятельно занимается этим бизнесом. Полученный урожай она  продаёт местным жителям по более низкой цене, чем на базаре, с первых рук. В целях повышения своей навыки Мехринисо приняла участие на тренинге «Добейся успеха» проведённого Ассоциация Деловых Женщин  и «Имон Интернешнл» в партнерстве с Международной Организацией Труда. В этом году из-за неблагополучной погоды Мехринисо не могла получить нормальный урожай, поэтому она обращалась в нашу организацию и хочет получить кредит для покупки скота тем самым хочет организовать новый бизнес по животноводству. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mehriniso is a very hard working and purposeful woman. She was born in a rural area and has sufficient experience with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. After school she worked in the field, in order to earn money and help her parents. 

Mehriniso especially grows wheat, sweet corn and other agricultural products. She has run this business independently for more than 6 months. She sells the harvest directly to the local residents at a lower price than at the market. With an aim to increase her skills, Mehriniso took part in the training "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead", held by the Association of Business Women and "IMON International", in partnership with the International Labor Organization. 

This year, due to unfavorable weather, Mehriniso was not able to get a normal harvest. Therefore she contacted our organization for a loan for the purchase of livestock, as she would like to set up a new business of livestock breeding. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for setting up a new business

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
Casada maritalmente, com um filho maior de idade e 3 netos
É trabalhadora da bananalândia a 15 anos e com o empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco e barrotes) para melhorar as suas condições habitacionais. 
No futuro deseja de concluir a sua residência e abrir um negócio para incrementar a sua renda, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio que se coloca para o cumprimento do seu projecto é o desemprego e doença.
texts.en: Married with one adult son and three grandchildren, Aida has been a banana lands worker since she was 15.  She aims to buy construction materials with the loan, such as corrugated metal and beams, to improve her housing conditions.  In the future, she wants to finish her home and start her own business to increase her income.  She is committed to repay the Hluvuku loan in order to request future loans.  The challenges she faces to complete her project are unemployment and illness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (corrugated metal and beams) to improve her housing conditions.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es: Ana con su anterior credikiva logró surtir su negocio y vender un poco mas porque los clientes se incrementaron y sus compras al por mayor y en efectivo le permitieron obtener  un mejor descuento. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradezco la ayuda recibida y deseo para ustedes y su familia mucha prosperidad. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a  un nuevo credikiva con el que comprará víveres, productos de aseo cárnicos y lácteos; con ello planea ganar un poco mas y continuar rotando sus productos rápidamente para que su inversión de crédito sea muy efectiva.
texts.en: Ana used her previous Kiva loan to stock her business and sell a bit more because her number of customers increased.  Her bulk purchases in cash made it possible to get better discounts.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is, “I appreciate the help and wish great prosperity to you and your family.”  She is asking for a new Kiva loan so she can buy ingredients, meat products for grilling, and milk products.  She plans to earn a bit more and continue to rotate her products quickly so that her loan investment is effective.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru:
Зебо женщина в возрасте 41 лет, замужем имеет 3 детей. Она работает в медицинском учреждении. Получаемая заработная плата, не хватает даже  на проживание.   Ее муж находиться в Российской Федерации,  и присылает ей деньги, эти  присылаемые  деньги уходят только на проживание.  
  В этом году Зебо  собирается женить своего сына, но для этого ей необходимо сделать ремонт дома.  У нее нет такой большой суммы чтобы отремонтировать свой дом.  Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом, чтобы получить финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Zebo is a woman of the age of 41. She is married and has three children. She works at a medical center. The salary she receives is not even enough for living expenses. Her husband is in the Russian Federation, and he sends her money. This money goes only to living expenses. 

This year Zebo decided to marry her son away, but for this she needs to make repairs to her house. She does not yet have a large enough sum of money to refurbish her house. Therefore she turned to "Arvand" for a loan, in order to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
Natural de Chibuto, separada mãe de dois filhos estudantes, além dos filhos sustenta um sobrinho e uma neta em cuidados alimentares, saúde e educação, é residente de Boane.
É empacotadora na bananalandia e com o presente crédito pretende comprar materiais construções (chapas de zinco e cimento) para substituir a antiga cobertura que já está degradada
No futuro almeja melhorar  suas condições habitacionais e envolve seus filhos em programas de geração de rendimento como forma de incrementar a renda familiar.
O seu maior desafio é conseguir um apoio financeiro no sentido de continuar a educar condignamente seus filhos e investir na sua obra.
texts.en:
A native of the Chibuto, Carolina is a separated mother of two children.  In addition to her two children, she also provides food, healthcare and education to sustain a nephew and a granddaughter.  She is a resident of Boane, Mozambique. 
She works as a packer in the bananalands and with this loan she plans to buy construction materials (cement and corrugated metal sheets) to replace their home's old roof that is already degraded.
In the future, she aims to improve their housing conditions and involve her children in money earning programs as a way to boost the family income.
Her biggest challenge is to get financial support to continue to educate her children with dignity and invest in their work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement and corrugated metal sheets) to replace the old roof that is already degraded.

loans.name: Martha Clelín

texts.es:
Martha es originaria de la linda ciudad de Estelí, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo en edad escolar, ella se caracteriza por ser una persona dinámica, responsable y con mucho amor para los niños.

Martha se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en una escuela especial donde solo atiende niños y niñas con problema de discapacidad, con más de diez años de trabajar con niños el cual confiesa que ha sido una buena experiencia y que cada día le motiva trabajar con los niños.

Martha solicita un crédito para la compra de medicamento, ya que su mamá se encuentra mal de salud y esta necesitando de un medicamento que es muy costoso. 

Agradece a kiva y ceprodel por el apoyo que le puedan brindar, ya que sin este financiamiento es imposible atender la salud de sus mamá.
texts.en:
Martha is from the beautiful city of  Estelí. She is a single mother with a school-aged child. She is a dynamic, responsible person who loves children.

Martha works as a primary school teacher in a special needs school for children with disabilities. She has worked with children for over ten years, which she says has been a good experience and that working with children motivates her every day.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy medicine, as her mother is unwell and needs a very expensive medicine.

She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they give, because without this loan it is impossible to look after the health of her mother.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a 45-year-old person who is married, with four children. She lives in Samburu, Kenya with her family in a solar powered house, with tap water. All her children are in school and that is why paying school fees is a major monthly expenditure for her. She has a business of buying and reselling goats after fattening.

Umazi has requested a loan amounting to KES 15,000 (Kenya shillings) to buy goats and cattle, to fatten and sell. She is grateful for your help.

loans.use: to buy goats and cattle, to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme de 43 ans. Elle est mariée à un déclarant en douanes et est mère de 03 enfants. L’ainé est agé de 21ans et le dernier 18ans. Deux(02) des enfants sont scolarisés. Elle travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames depuis 1991, s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays et vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place. Akossiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames. Elle espère agrandir son activité et contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 43 year old woman. She is married to a customs officer with whom she has three children. The eldest is 21 and the youngest 18 years old. Two of her children attend school.  She has worked as a seller of yams since 1991, sourcing her goods from inland and selling them in a local market. Akossiwa is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase yams. She hopes to boost her business activity and contribute to her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase yams

loans.name: Anzor

texts.en:
Anzor is 49 years old. He lives in Senaki District with his wife Nato, who is also 49 years old. Several times, Anzor requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Anzor and his wife are farmers. They have one milk cow and one calf. Nato milks the cow every day and makes cheese, which she sells locally at the markets. They also have plot of agricultural land, where maize and nut trees are grown. Anzor is cultivating land every spring, before sowing. Harvested products are also sold at the local markets. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Anzor requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Anzor will purchase cement for his construction block workshop, which is not functional at the moment. This will help him to start a new business and sell blocks locally at the market. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase his income and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cement for his construction block workshop.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 40 years old and a food kiosk owner in Tononoka, Mombasa. He is a single man, and he supports no one.  He has been in his business for the past four years and is doing great.

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD, to finance his business by purchasing dried foods, cereals, sugar, cooking fat and charcoal, to resell at his kiosk. 

He will use the anticipated profit to pay his loan and make his business grow to new heights. He hopes to establish a company in the future, and he will offer support services to other members of the community.

loans.use: to purchase dried foods, cereals, sugar, cooking fat and charcoal, to resell at his kiosk

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 32 años actualmente soltera es una madre muy empeñosa en cuanto a la misión de brindarle a su pequeño Fonzhy de 5 añitos todo el fruto de su trabajo y hacer de el un gran hombre.Vive en la casa de sus padres.Profesora de profesión, pero emprendedora de vocación decidió iniciar un negocio de manera independiente y abrir una tienda de abarrotes. Hace como un año logro alquilar un local y hasta el momento comenta que le va bien en cuanto a la considerable demanda que poseen normalmente los productos de primera necesidad como son el azúcar, el arroz y productos enlatados como la leche y conservas.Complementa su negocio con la venta de cremoladas preparadas a base de maíz morado y maracuyá .A manera de surtir nuevamente su negocio desea contar con capital de trabajo, por esta razón desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de  productos tales como azúcar, arroz, conservas y productos de limpieza.Este es su primer crédito con MFP, razón por la cual muestra su profundo agradecimiento y espera mostrar su puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Nancy is 32 years old and a very hardworking single mother of her five year old Fonzhy who she works hard to raise into a great man.  She lives with her parents and is a teacher by trade, but an entrepreneur by vocation, so she decided to open a grocery store.  She managed to rent out a location about a year ago, and she says that things are going well for her because of the demand for the primary needs products such as sugar, rice, and canned goods such as milk and jams.  She will complement her business with corn-based passion fruit slushes.  She would like to be able to count on more working capital, so she is asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy products such as sugar, rice, jams, and cleaning products.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very grateful and expects to be on time with her loans.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es: María Fernanda es una joven luchadora, ella desea mejorar la vivienda de su familia. Por lo que ha pedido un préstamo por millón cuarenta mil colones (1.040.000) con lo cual comprará los materiales necesarios para hacerle los arreglos a su casa. con esto pretende tener una vivienda mas digna y vivir mejor junto con sus padres.
texts.en: María Fernanda is a tenacious young lady who would like to improve her family home.  She has requested a loan for 1,040,000 colones which she will use to buy the materials she needs to make some repairs to her home.  This will allow her to live in a decent home together with her parents.

loans.use: to buy materials with which to improve her home

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 38-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children. She is engaged in the fishing business. She has been in this business for twelve years now together with her husband. This is the source of her income and their daily consumption.

Leonora is requesting a loan to buy fish net, hooks and floaters. These are the materials that will be used in fishing and to catch many fish. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy these materials and can go fishing.

In the future, Leonora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, hooks and floaters.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Ms. Musarat is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been running a business trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community. 

Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed, so she initiated her own business to fulfill the needs of the family members. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for six years. Currently, Musarat requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Taghrid

texts.en:
Taghrid is a 25-year-old, single woman. She has been working as a hair dresser, from her house, since 2010. Taghrid has 10 years of experience in this field. She is a Palestinian refugee. Almost all of the Palestinian refugees living in Lebanon have to require their children to begin working early, to help the family in making their living. This was the case for Taghrid, who was only 15 years old when she had to start working.

Taghrid is determined to expand and develop her business; that's why she requested a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to make this step forward. With the money from this loan, she will open a separate beauty salon, outside her parents' house, to help her customers be relaxed and to expand her working area.

She hopes to keep on developing her business, which will impact positively her family's social and financial situations. She hopes that one day, she will be able to move her business and earn her living outside the refugee camp.

loans.use: to buy the tools and products she needs to open a beauty salon outside her parents' house, where she works now

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia operates a sari-sari (variety) store in order to earn a living. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. Letecia has been in the business for several years.

Letecia is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to resell, like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, seasonings, soap, shampoo and toiletries. With these purchases, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers, allowing her to sell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to resell, like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, seasonings, soap, shampoo and toiletries

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married with five children. She is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.                      

Conchita is a farmer and grows corn as a crop to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers.

Conchita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more corn every cropping.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Arooj

texts.en:
Ms Arooj is a 31-year-old lady; she has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as make-up, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing of services, she has become famous in her street. In order to meet the increasing demand of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. 

Ms Arooj needs a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater for more customers time after time. With the help of the loan, she will not only purchase a variety of products but will also able to meet her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Kareeman

texts.en:
Ms Kareeman is 57 years old, a married woman running a business of milk sales for the past five years. She has 5 buffaloes and 4 cows giving milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and products that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is a mother of seven children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with food and clothing.  

Ms Kareeman has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life.  It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through Kashf's support. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to have an increase in her production capacity which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Dossou

texts.fr: Monsieur Dossou a 52 ans et est marié et a 4 enfants dont 03 à l'école. Pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, il exerce comme activité la blanchisserie. Il compte 18 ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Il achète ces outils de travail au grand marché de Lomé et travaille avec une personne dans la boutique. Il sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter du séchoir et aménager son atelier. Son profit lui permettra d'ouvrir une seconde boutique et assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: Mister Dossou is 52 years old and is married with 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. In order to see to his children's needs he has worked in the laundry business for 18 years. He buys his work tools from the large market in Lomé and works with one other person in his store. He is seeking his third loan in order to purchase  a dryer and to refurbish his store. The profits he generates will enable him to open a second shop and to see to his family's fundamental needs.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer and to refurbish his store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth de 46 años, está casada con Lucio de 55 años , con quien tres hijas , las cuales son el motor de su vida.Actualmente reside junto a su familia en una vivienda construida a base de material noble ,la cual construyo con el apoyo de su esposo.Inicialmente se desempeñaba como cocinera en un restaurante para posteriormente aperturar un pequeño restaurante en donde se dedica a preparar pollos a la brasa.
Lleva 8 años en este negocio y con el paso de los años ha logrado convertirlo en un negocio estable razón por la cual obtiene buenos ingresos económicos. Comenta que al inicio no le fue sencillo puesto que no tenia demasiada clientelea pero ahora con el apoyo de sus hijas ha logrado ser una comerciante muy emprendedora.A manera de mejorar algunos aspectos de su negocio desea contar con un capital económico para la compra de gaseosas y demás bebidas solicitadas por sus clientes ,por ese motivo requiere de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de dichos productos , a su vez se muestra alegre por  acceder a su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera responsable.
texts.en:
46-year-old Ruth is married to Lucio, who is 55.  The couple have three daughters who are their motivation in life.  Ruth currently lives with her family in a home which she built with the support of her husband.  The house is built from good-quality materials.

Ruth used to work as a cook in a restaurant but then decided to open her own small restaurant where she prepares roast chicken.  Ruth has been running her business for 8 years and, over the years, she has managed to turn it into a stable business which makes good income.  She says that things weren't easy at first as she didn't have many customers but now, with the support of her daughters, she has become a very entrepreneurial saleswoman.

In order to improve her business, Ruth would like to have enough capital to buy soda and other drinks that her customers are requesting.  She needs 1,000 soles to buy these products.  Ruth is happy to be taking out her first loan with MFP and pledges to make her repayments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy soda

loans.name: Safae

texts.en:
Safae is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. Safae lives with his parents and his three brothers, two of whom aid Safae in providing the income of the family.

Safae owns a blacksmith's shop and specializes in making doors and windows. He established his business in 2009, and now he has an employee. He built up good experience in this field and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Safae is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a loan to pay the yearly rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop

loans.name: Isdora

texts.en:
Isdora is a married lady, aged 27 years, and they have three children aged between 10 and five years old. She sells fruit and has been in the business for a period of 10 years, earning an income of KES. 10,000.

She is now servicing her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase various stock of fruit and vegetables for resale.  

The profits she will get will be used to improve the living standards of her family members and pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To stock more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen is 34 years old, a married woman and the mother of three children.  She has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies.  She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Ms. Sharifan is a 56-year-old widow; she has been doing a business of selling milk for the past 30 years. She has five buffaloes and two cows for milk. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

She has two daughters and one son. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. 

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 Rs (Pakistani rupees) to purchase one more cow. She hopes to have an increase in her production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: La Source 3 Group

texts.en:
Odette, age 55, is a widow with four children, ages 19 to 33 years old. Her youngest child is currently attending university. She is representing the La Source 3 group. Odette sells vegetables and recently started selling drinks. She used her last loan with HOPE to buy a freezer to keep her drinks in. She will use this loan to buy more drinks as well as lettuce, onions, and tomatoes. 

Odette has been selling vegetables in the market for over 10 years and drinks just over a month. She is excited to have added a new product to her business. Her business strategy is to personally visit clients at their homes and deliver the merchandise they order. 

Odette has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She would like to travel abroad one day to buy merchandise to sell in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to pay for tomatoes, lettuce, onions, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina de 51 años ,viuda y con 5 hijos trabaja para brindarles lo mejor a su vez comparte sus vivencias familiares en una casa construida con bloques de adobe. Desde muy niña acompaño a sus padres y a su vez aprendió el oficio de la agricultura ligado a la producción de cacao orgánico.Con el paso de los años y al cumplir la mayoría de edad opto por  trabajar en las parcelas que le heredarón sus padres y seguir con el oficio familiar.Despues del fallecimiento de su esposo optó por continuar con está actividad a su vez cuenta con el apoyo de trabajadores  del lugar a quienes remunera por los trabajos de deshierbo y deschuponado de plantas que son algo dificultosas según cuenta.Para continuar con el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones desea contar con capital para la compra de abono orgánico y plantas de almácigo y así mejorar su producción a corto y largo plazo.Comenta que todo el fruto de su esfuerzo será finalmente brindado a sus hijos quienes ya se encuentran desempeñando estudios superiores fuera de su localidad razón por la cual solicita 500 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos con abono orgánico ,los cuales al ser aplicados de manera correcta aportan de manera significativa con el resultado de su producción de cacao ,a su vez se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Paulina, 51, is a widow with five children who works to provide for them as best she can. She and her family live in a house built with adobe blocks. From the time she was a young child, she learned from her parents the agricultural trade of producing organic cocoa. As the years passed and she came of age, she opted to work on the land that she inherited from her parents and continue with the family business. 

After the death of her husband she chose to continue this work with the help of workers at the site who she pays for the work of weeding and thinning the plants, which, according to Paulina, are somewhat difficult. To continue maintaining her plantation, she would like to have capital to purchase compost and nursery plants and improve production in the short and long term. She says that all the fruits of her efforts will ultimately be given to her children who are already pursuing higher education outside the community. 

She is requesting 500 nuevos soles to purchase bags of compost, which when applied correctly will significantly contribute to the yield of her cocoa production. She is grateful for this opportunity and agrees to pay her dues on time.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 31 años, esta casada con Fredy de 28 años y ambos tienen un niño de 3 añitos.Reside junto a su pequeña familia en una vivienda construida a base de ladrillos en calidad de alquiler.Con la llegada de su pequeño opto por abandonar su principal actividad de aquel entonces consistente en la venta de ropa cuya labor desempeñaba de manera constante, al tener la responsabilidad de estar al pendiente de su retoño opto por dejar la vida laboral teniendo como principal sustento a Fredy quien se desempeña como chofer de ruta provincial.A manera de reingresar a la vida laboral desea junto a su pareja aperturar un negocio consistente en la venta de celulares, accesorios y crédito para llamadas.Considera esta una buena oportunidad de negocio puesto que en su localidad no existen muchos comercios del rubro.Su objetivo a largo plazo es adquirir un vehiculo propio para su esposo y asi ambos puedan aportar a la ecónomia de su hogar.Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a cumplir de manera puntual con el pago de su préstamo esperando demostrar así su completo agradecimiento.En esta oportunidad requiere contar con 500 nuevos soles y complementar su capital para la compra de accesorios para celulares como cargadores, audífonos entre otros.
texts.en: Rebeca is 31 years old, she is married to Fredy, who is 28 years old, and together they have one three-year-old son. She lives together with her small family in a brick house which they rent. With the arrival of her little one, she decided to drop the work she was doing at the time, which consisted of the laborious and near constant work of selling clothing, in order to look after their child. Thus their primary source of income was Fredy, who works as a bus driver on provincial routes. As a way of reentering the workforce she hopes to open up a business selling cellular phones, accessories, and calling cards. She believes this is a good business opportunity because there are not many businesses of this type in her town. Her long term goal is to purchase her own vehicle so that both she and Fredy may contribute to household finances. This is her first loan cycle with MFP, and she promises to make punctual payments on her loan as a way of demonstrating her complete gratitude. In this cycle she is seeking 500 nuevos soles to supplement her own money in order to purchase cell phone accessories such as chargers, headsets, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase telephone accessories.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva Hermencia logró aumentar su capital de trabajo y obtener una mayor estabilidad económica, porque sus ventas aumentaron y también sus utilidades. Hoy se encuentra aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará medicina natural, perfumería y artículos para su hogar. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Muy agradecida con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con Kiva, deseo continuar recibiendo tan grande apoyo”. Con su nueva inversión obtendrá los fondos suficientes para atender los pedidos de su clientela fija y esto la ayudará a que cada vez ellos sean más fieles y a continuar ganado con sus ventas
texts.en: Herminia used her previous Kiva loan to increase her working capital and achieve greater financial stability.  Her sales increased and so too did her profits.  She is currently applying for a new loan to buy natural medicines, perfumes and some household items.  Her message to Kiva lenders is as follows: "I am very grateful to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva and I hope to continue receiving their help".  As a result of this new investment, Herminia will have available the funds she needs to fill orders placed by her regular customers.  This will help her to ensure their continued loyalty and she will be able to continue making good sales.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines, perfumes and household items

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Ms. Noreen is 26 years old.  She is married and works at home as a tailor.  She has been in business for the last six years and is proud to be contributing to her household income.  When Noreen was not earning an income, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner.  At that time, her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family and, due to limited resources, none of their children were sent to school.  Noreen felt it necessary to change her family’s standard of living and therefore started working from home.  

She is a brave woman but she was having difficulty fulfilling large orders.  That is when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf Foundation.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR and she will use it to purchase a new stitching machine, some thread, lace and zippers in various colors.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, some thread, lace and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 28-year-old married woman who enjoys doing hand embroidery. She started doing this work with her daughters. She has four children and is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education as her husband’s earning alone is not enough to meet the needs of the family. 

Her embroidery patterns have become popular in her community. Due to the increasing demand of her embroidery designs, she is including other women in her business. In order to purchase cloths, threads, and stones of various colors, she is requesting a loan of Rs. 20000 from Kashf Foundation. She is in her second loan cycle and has demonstrated excellent repayment behavior. She expects an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of it on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cloths, threads, and stones of various colors for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. For about 10 years, she has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to establish a client base that allows her to earn money to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy spools of threads of different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. By doing so, she would be able to more consistently cater her designs to more customers. She is hopeful that she will be able to increase her income by targeting more customers. Zakia dreams of her children's bright future and of expanding her business in the near future. She is very much thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads of different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: La Source 2 Group

texts.en:
Giscard, age 42, is single with four children, ages 1 to 23 years old. He has two children currently attending school. He is representing the La Source 2 group. Giscard has an electronics game room where he has TVs and video-game consoles for people to use by the hour. These are very common in Congo as many people do not have DVD players and game consoles at home. He has had this small business for three years. 

He will use the loan to pay for new DVDs and video games. His business strategy is to offer great customer service. He feels the way you work and interact with your customers is very important. 

Giscard has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to have a large building for his game room one day.

loans.use: to pay for DVDs and games.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is a married client from Iraq who is 45 years old and a father of four children. Hussain is the only provider of the family. 

Hussain owns a blacksmith's shop. He specializes in making doors and windows. He has been in this field since his childhood and established his own career in 2004 and now he has hired an employee.  He has built up a good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hussain is requesting a sum of $2,400 loan to buy a big motor generator. This loan will aid Hussain to grow his business in increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his children a good education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a big motor generator

loans.name: La Source 1 Group

texts.en:
Alexis, age 37, is married with five children, ages 1 to 17 years old. He has four children attending school. He is representing the La Source 1 group. Alexis is a hair stylist and owns a hair salon. He has been operating this business for 13 years. He will use the loan to buy hair products, hair dryers, and a sterilizer. He plans to open another location during this loan cycle, so some of the products he buys will go to his new location. His business strategy is to always be improving and beautifying his salon. 

Alexis has received two previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He would like to travel abroad to learn more about hair styling and salons. He then wants to come back and open a grand salon in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to pay for hair products, hair dryers, and a sterilizer.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a married client from Iraq. He is 47 years old and a father of four children, one of whom assists him in providing the family income.

Mahdi owns a garage and specializes in repairing vehicles. He established his business in 2004, and now he has an employee hired. He built good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Mahdi is requesting a sum of $2,400 to pay the annual rent for his garage. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may be able to open a bigger garage one day.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his garage.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a married Iraqi who is 39 years old and has 7 children. Haydar is the only provider for his family.
Haydar owns a small retail store selling detergents, soaps and shampoos. He also specializes in selling perfumes and deodorants. He established his business in 2011. He has acquired good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Haydar is requesting a sum of $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his children with the best education possible.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has had a fishing business for more than three years, together with her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters. With this, they will be able to improve their business and eventually increase their income.
Rogelyn dreams of expanding her business, as well as saving money for the future schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters for her fishing business.

loans.name: Ibtihaj

texts.en:
Ibtihaj is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has been working in the food business since two years ago. She is a hardworking woman who puts in so much effort to provide her family with the necessary needs. That's why she always needs an external support to better improve her business to increase her income. 

Ibtihaj is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to help her husband start a new business to increase the family's income and improve their living. She will also support her business through buying necessary merchandise for her store, especially for the coming spring and summer seasons.

She hopes that this loan will be a good step forward for improving her family's social and financial living.

loans.use: to help her husband start a new business, as well as buy necessary merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fouras

texts.en:
Fouras is a married youth client from Iraq, who is 29 years old and is the father of a single child. Fouras is the only provider of the family.

Fouras owns a small shop for selling glass plates, which are used to install display windows for shops. Fouras not only sells, but also installs display windows. He established his business in 2011. He has good experience in this field and is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Fouras is requesting the sum of $1,800 for a youth loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: Emmanuel 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Rose, age 42, is single with six children, ages 2 to 24 years old. She has three children currently attending school. She is representing the Emmanuel 2 (1) group. 

Rose sells a variety of fruit at a stall. She has had this small business for 18 years. During this time, she has gained a good reputation in the market and loyal customers. She will use the loan to buy assorted fruits (depending on the season), including mangoes, pineapples, bananas, and passion fruit. 

Rose has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to sell a more diverse group of products in the future.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana sabe cómo trabajar con su negocio, ella aprovecha las temporadas de mayor movimiento para obtener un credikiva y con ello tener un gran surtido de pescados. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo financiamiento, no sin antes enviarle a sus financiadores muchas bendiciones a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y a sus financiadores de Kiva , a quienes piden la sigan apoyando.  Su nuevo credikiva lo invertirá en pescado y camarones especialmente, aunque también sus clientes de mercancía han hecho sus pedidos y los complacerá, porque ella es muy puntual, ofrecer precios justos y plazos adecuados para poder cobrar su cartera de manera cómoda y sin perder su dinero invertido.
texts.en: Juana knows how to work her business. She takes advantage of the busiest seasons to obtain a Kiva loan and in this way to have a large assortment of fish. For this reason she is asking for a new loan, only after sending her blessings to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and to her Kiva lenders, who she asks for continued support. She will use the new loan to buy fish and prawns, although her merchandise customers have already placed orders and he will honor those, because she is very punctual. She offers fair prices and appropriate repayment periods to be able to recover her moneys in a comfortable manner and without losing the money she had invested.

loans.use: to buy fish and prawns as well as other merchandise.

loans.name: Roqia

texts.en:
Ms. Roqia is a 31-year-old woman.  She has been in the business of selling milk for the past 20 years.  She has two calves and one cow.  She sells milk as well as butter that she makes from the milk to many of her neighbors.  Her business is strong enough to enable her to lead a decent life.  She is very motivated to provide her sister and brother a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It is her first year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with Kashf’s support.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR in order to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.  She hopes to increase her production capacity, which will ultimately help her generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Shahnaze

texts.en: Shahnaze is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of three children. Twenty-five years ago, she started her own sewing business in her home.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver but his income is not sufficient to meet their daily requirements. She was worried but she didn’t lose hope and eventually contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor in order to establish her business. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kash Foundation. Currently, she is requesting a loan of Rs. 20000. She is going to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine with some spools of threads of various colors. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some spools of threads of various colors for her sewing business.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a 21-year-old Iraqi who is single and lives with his parents. 
Haydar owns a grocery store that sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks.
Since childhood, he has helped his father in the same grocery store. He took over this family business in 2008. He has developed good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Haydar is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to buy a motor generator and two new freezers. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may buy a bigger shop one day. He hopes to eventually work both as a retailer and a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and two new freezers

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella has a farming business whhere she grows cash crops and keeps poultry. Since joining KADET, her monthly income has greatly multiplied. She now earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She is applying for her sixth loan of KES 30,000 with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

She is applying for an education loan to pay her children's school fees. Part of the loan will be used to buy chicken feed for her poultry. Her hopes and dreams are to give her children the best education and to secure their future.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees and to buy chicken feed for her farm.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera; su compañero de vida la abandono por otra persona dejándola con tres hijos. Actualmente, solo uno vive con ella, los otros dos ya se casaron. Ella se dedica a la agricultura junto con su hijo; su padre fue quien le enseño esta actividad; también se dedica a lavar ropa de otras personas, elabora tortillas; además, realiza trabajos agrícolas como abonar, regar herbicidas, sembrando, tapiscando, etc. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. a realizar los oficios domésticos de su casa para luego irse a su trabajo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres toretes para repasto. Los repastara en el rastrojo que le quedo de la cosecha, quiere aprovechar ese alimento. Cuando los animales estén gordos, los podrá vender y de las ganancias desea comprar un refrigerador para su casa. Su propósito, es ahorrar para construir una casa de ladrillo, arreglar la escritura de un terreno que le heredo su padre y que su hijo se gradúe de bachiller.
texts.en:
Maria, 45, is a single mother; her life partner abandoned her for someone else, leaving her with three kids. Currently, only one lives with her as the other two are already married. She works in agriculture with her son, having been taught by her father her how to do it. She also is a laundress, makes tortillas, and does farm work like spreading manure, spraying herbicides, planting, harvesting, etc. She gets up at 4:30am to do the household chores before she leaves to work. 

She asks for a loan from Fundacion Campo to buy 3 small bulls to fatten up. She will fatten them on the waste that was left from her harvest, as she wants to take advantage of that food. When the animals are fat, she will be able to sell them and use the earnings to buy a refrigerator for her house. Her goal is to save to build a brick house, arrange the deed on a piece of land she inherited from her father, and for her son to graduate from high school.

loans.use: to buy 3 small bulls to fatten

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Ms. Asma is a 21-year-old lady.  She is very talented and excels in her chosen work of tailoring.  She has received a lot of appreciation from her community.  She has retained a regular list of customers and earns enough to contribute to the family income.  

Currently, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PKR in order to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors.  In this way she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand from her customers, which ultimately helps her generate more cash.  Asma hopes to grow her business and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors.

loans.name: Lilivit

texts.en:
Lilivit is a 47-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has nine children. Her eldest child is 16 years old and her youngest is 3 years old. She has a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for 10 years now. This is the source of her income.

Lilivit is requesting for a loan to buy hog feed. This will make her pigs grow faster. With this loan, she will be able to buy the necessary feed.

In the future, Lilivit hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed.

loans.name: Yaakoub

texts.en:
Yaakoub is a married Iraqi who is 32 years old and has two children. Yaakoub is the only provider for his family.
Yaakoub owns a small shop specializing in motorcycle repair. He has been in this field for over 6 years. His passion for motorcycles led him to start this business, which he established in 2010. Yaakoub now has 2 employees, has gained good experience, and has earned an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.
Yaakoub is requesting a loan of $3,000 to renovate his shop by installing a rolling shutter and signage. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing a rolling shutter and signage.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old, married to Margret, and a father of one child. He is an electrician and has been running his business for the last five years. His monthly income is KES 15,000. He learned about KADET LTD from a business colleague who is already a registered member.

He is requesting his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and this will assist him in purchasing mobile phone accessories, spares and associated items. He plans to use the anticipated profits to further invest in his business and increase his inventory. 

His dream is to have a stable business and income that will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories for sale.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a married Iraqi client who is 43 years old and has two children. Both Mahdi and his two children provide the income of the family together.

Mahdi is a structural material dealer and specializes in selling ceramic. He established his business in 2010. He has good experience in the field and has gained an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Mahdi is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his shop by installing a rolling shutter, an external ceiling, and a display window. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide a decent life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing a rolling shutter, an external ceiling, and a display window.

loans.name: Emmanuel 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Ferdinand, age 48, is married with 3 children ages 14 to 25 years old. His youngest is currently attending school. He is representing the Emmanuel 2 (2) group. 

Ferdinand sells clothes in the market and has been doing this for 10 years. He will use the loan to buy more clothes from his supplier. His business strategy is to work hard. He believes good work ethic brings good results.

This is Ferdinand's first loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. HOPE and his group are confident he will repay the loan. 

One day, he wants to own a shop on Avenue de la Paix, a main road in one of Brazzaville's major shopping districts. He hopes his children will be successful and happy in life.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Le Chandelier 3 Group

texts.en:
Reine, age 27, is married, with no children yet. He is representing the Le Chandelier 3 Group. 

Reine has a small grocery shop and has been operating it for four years. He will use the loan to buy wine, cookies, candy, and other food products for his shop. His business strategy is to allow returning customers to buy merchandise on credit. 

This is Reine's first loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo S.A. HOPE Congo S.A. and his group are confident he will repay the loan. Reine wants to continue to expand his business and become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to pay for wine, cookies, candy, and other food products for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es:
Napoleón de 47 años de edad, soltero con dos un hijo de ocho años. Originario de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor es que tiene por actividad económica prestar  servicios musicales, desde hace 14 años, y lo desempeña de forma ambulante y por contrato. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la comprar de instrumentos musicales como: amplificador, parlantes, micrófonos, luces. Computadora. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Napoleón agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Napoleón is a 47-year-old single man with an 8-year-old son.  He is originally from Malpaisillo, which is in the western part of the country.  He is a hardworking, responsible man who is motivated to better himself.  Regrettably, due to lack of financial resources, he was not able to pursue a college degree.

Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit, he started a business providing musical services.  He has been doing this for 14 years, and he works on a contract basis.  He is seeking a loan so that he can invest sound equipment such as amplifiers, speakers, and microphones, as well as a computer and lights.  This should enable him to increase his income in the near future.

Napoleón is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the help that they provide to individuals who have scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.  This support enables these individuals to work with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in sound equipment such as amplifiers, speakers, and microphones, as well as a computer and lights.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery compró un kit de luces y lentes con el que se siente muy satisfecha pues los activos de su estudio de fotografía  mejoraron  y con ello su oferta. Ella dice que está agradecida con Kiva por su financiamiento a los fotógrafos, y espera los sigan apoyando. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará una cámara fotográfica, que modernizará una vez más su estructura de negocio.
texts.en: Rosmery bought a kit of lights and lenses that she is very happy with since the assets of her photography studio improved and, with them, what she has to offer. She is grateful to Kiva for their financing of photographers, and hopes they continue supporting them. Currently she is applying for a new loan to buy a camera that will once again modernize her business.

loans.use: to buy a camera.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married Iraqi client, who is 37 years old and has three children.  Ali is the sole provider for the family.

Ali owns a small shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories.  He has been in this field for a long time and, after gaining good experience, he established his own business in 2010 and has hired an employee.  Ali is well known in the surrounding area and has gained an excellent reputation.

Ali is requesting a loan of $2,400 in order to renovate his shop by installing a rolling shutter, a display window and an external ceiling.  He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing a rolling shutter, a display window and an external ceiling.

loans.name: Eustacia

texts.es: Eustacia compró muchas escobas y las vendió prontamente,  generando nuevas utilidades que la han ayudado a invertir un poco más y esto fue gracias a su anterior crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Hoy está aplicando a un nueva financiación,mediante Kiva,  con la cual comprará nuevamente escobas, útiles escolares, artículos de primera necesidad, para generar capital fresco que complementa con su recuperación de cartera. Eustacia envía un mensaje de agradecimiento y dice que con el apoyo financiero que la Fundación le dió a su negocio ahora tiene más clientes, por eso está muy entusiasmada con su primer credikiva.
texts.en:
Eustacia bought many brooms and sold them quickly, generating new profits that have helped her to invest a little more thanks to her previous loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

Today she is applying for a new loan through Kiva, which she will use to buy more brooms, school supplies and basic staples to generate new capital that will complement her portfolio recovery. 

Eustacia sends a message of thanks and says that with the financial support that the Foundation gave her business, she now has more customers, so she is very excited about her first credikiva.

loans.use: to buy brooms, school supplies and staple items.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es: Milagro de 20 años es comerciante desde hace 2 ,cuando inició su negocio de venta ropa exterior y accesorios femeninos, porque necesitó ingresos para transportarse, fotocopiar sus tareas y merendar, pues había iniciado  estudios  requería  sostenerse en la universidad  en su carrera de Derecho. Las principales mercancías de su oferta son jeans, camisas, colonias y accesorios femeninos, los cuales vende a crédito entre su principal clientela, que se encuentra en el lugar donde estudia y alrededor de donde habita. Desde las 8 de la mañana hasta que lo requiera su clientela,  se dedica al negocio al mismo tiempo que a sus estudios, porque su sueño es tener un almacén de ropa y a nivel personal convertirse en una profesional de éxito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará: perfumería, ropa, femenina y accesorios, que sus clientes le han encargado y como siempre ella estará dispuesta a complacerlos para hacerlos cada vez más fieles.
texts.en:
Milagro, 20, has been selling clothing and women's accessories for 2 years, because she needed income to pay for transportation, copies of homework, and snacks. She had started her studies and needed a way to sustain herself at the university while studying the law. The main things she sells are jeans, shirts, colognes and women's accessories. She sells them on credit to her main customers, who she finds at school and near where she lives. From 8am until whenever her customers need her, she works at the same time as she studies because her dream is to have a clothing store, and to become a successful professional. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy perfume, women's clothing and accessories that her customers have ordered. As always, she will be happy to please them so that their loyalty increases.

loans.use: to buy perfume, women's clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Abed Al Ilah

texts.en:
Abed Al Ilah is a 27-year-old single man.  He has been working as a tailor, sewing internal and external curtains for the past eleven years.  He was only sixteen years old when he quit school and entered the business world to help his parents improve their standard of living.  In 2005, he bought his first tailoring machine and started working from his parents’ house.  That was his first step towards developing his own business and earning an income.

Today Abed Al Ilah is well known in the region and recommended by most of his customers.  He is very anxious to expand his business but he has shortage in cash.  That is why he has applied for a YOUTH LOAN for the first time from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua.  This loan will help him buy the necessary tools and machines to improve and expand his business.

He is very optimistic about the results from the requested loan.  Further, he hopes that, as a result of this loan, he will be able to move his business to an external shop very soon.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools and machines to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is 27 years old. She is married with two children, both of whom are in school. Her major monthly expense is school fees payment.

She operates a charcoal stall and has financial constraints. That is why she has approached for a loan amounting to 30000 KES to buy sacks of charcoal.

She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Le Chandelier 2 Group

texts.en:
Francoise, age 43, is married with four children, ages 10 to 23 years old. She has three children currently attending school. She is representing the Le Chandelier 2 group. 

Francoise sells used clothing in a local market and has had this business for 18 years. She has gained many loyal customers over the years. She will use the loan to buy a large bale of used clothing. In Congo, suppliers sell used clothing in large bales, which the vendors then separate out to sell. Her business strategy is to give a small gift (i.e., an extra piece of clothing) to returning customers. 

Francoise has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She would like for all of her children to be able to study in France. She has one son now who is studying at a university in France.

loans.use: to pay for a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is a married client from Iraq, who is 41 years old and has two children. Asaad is the only provider of the family.
Asaad owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2005. He has gained good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Asaad is requesting a loan of $2,400 to buy a big motor generator and to increase his food inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children with a better standard of living and a good education.

loans.use: to buy a big motor generator and to increase his food inventory

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es: Jonnhy compró muchos artículos con su credikiva anterior como accesorios para celulares, DVD, carteras, collares y estuches, Hoy está muy satisfecho con los resultados porque logró con su inversión aumentar ligeramente su capital de trabajo, por eso acude a un nuevo financiamiento en estos mismos artículos, porque siendo productos de alta rotación, generan utilidades inmediatas que aumentan su nivel de vida y el de su familia, de manera gradual. El envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Muchas gracias por su ayuda y que Dios los apoye siempre para que sigan ayudando a mas personas. “
texts.en:
With the funds from his previous loan, Johnny purchased many items, such as cell phone accessories, phone cards, cases, DVDs, and necklaces.  Currently he is very satisfied with the results, because with his investment he was able to expand his offerings to his customers.  Thus, he is seeking a new loan so that he can purchase more of the same items.  Since these products are in high demand, they generate immediate income, which helps him to gradually improve his family's standard of living.

He wishes to send the following message to the Kiva lenders:

"Thank you very much for your support, and may God bless you so that you can continue to help even more people."

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories, phone cards, cases, DVDs, and necklaces.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a married Iraqi client who is 37 years old and has five children. He is the only provider for his family.

Ahmad owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He built good experience in the field and has gained an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Ahmad is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his shop by installing a display window and a rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his children with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing a display window and a rolling shutter.

loans.name: Les Elites 3 Group

texts.en:
Aymar, age 37, is single with no children. He is representing the Les Elites 3 group. Aymar sells phone cards and phone credit around Brazzaville. He has had this business for five years. Phone companies in Congo normally do not give contracts, but instead sell phone cards or credit through vendors throughout the city. Aymar will use the loan to buy SIM cards and phone cards from varying companies. His business strategy is to have all the products his customers normally want at all times. 
Aymar has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to continue to grow his business and become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to pay for phone cards and SIM cards.

loans.name: Les Elites 2 Group

texts.en:
Valentine, age 50, is married with 3 children, ages 8 to 13 years old. All of her children are currently attending school. She is representing the Les Elites 2 group. Valentine has a stall where she sells a variety of food. She has had this business for over 20 years. She will use the loan to buy sardines, salt, beans, and salted fish. Valentine has gained valuable experience over the years and has developed a good reputation in the community. 
She has received 2 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. Her dream is to travel abroad one day and see other places around the world. She wants her children to be happy and successful in life.

loans.use: buy sardines, salt, beans, and salted fish for sale

loans.name: Les Elites 1 Group

texts.en:
Danielle, age 26, is single with 2 children, ages 3 and 6 years old. Both of her children are attending school or nursery during the day. She is representing the Les Elites 1 group. Danielle has a business selling mattresses, and has had this business for 6 years. She will use the loan to buy more mattresses to stock her shop. Her business strategy is to be proactive by calling her customers and asking them if they need a mattress or some other type of bedding. 
Danielle has received 2 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to continue to grow her business through the loans. She would like to buy a parcel of land for her family in the future. She hopes her children will be educated and successful.

loans.use: to buy mattresses for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baking stones and and oven for making pizzas.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is still doing farming on her piece of land. She has been able to expand her business thanks to the financial help she has received from KADET LTD and Kiva. Her monthly income has increased and now she earns 8,000 KES. She is requesting a second business loan to enable her to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to prepare her land for the next planting season. Her hopes and dreams are to excel in her business as farmer.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат вдова с двумя детьми. Ей 44 года. Ее старший сын в данное время находится на заработках в загранице. Сама Шафоат зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь торговлей. У нее есть магазин, где она продает продукты питания (конфеты, печенье, сахар, чай, макароны, растительное масло и т.д.). Она занята в этой сфере более 8 лет. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот и получить хорошую прибыль, Шафоат обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит для приобретения продуктов питания и за счет прибыли с продажи устроить свадьбу детей.
texts.en: Shafoat is 44 years old, a widow and the mother of two children.  Her older son is currently working in another country to earn money.  She sell food products to earn a living.  She has a store where she sells her goods (candies, cookies, sugar, tea, pasta, cooking oil, etc., etc.).  This has been her profession for more than 8 years.  In order to increase her turnover as well as her profits, Shafoat is taking out a loan.  With these funds, she will buy more goods and use the additional income to pay for her children's wedding.

loans.use: To buy food products to raise funds for a wedding.

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es: Emilse de 35 años de edad tiene una tienda en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del mar, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 6 a 15 años. En Enero del año 2011, su suegro, de edad avanzada y toda la vida dedicado a una tienda, decidió entregársela a su hijo y  a Emilse para generar su sustento. En su tienda vende al detalle artículos de la canasta familiar como víveres, ranchos, refrescos, cárnicos, lácteos etc. Su negocio es atendido por Emilse desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días, vendiendo a crédito y en un mayor porcentaje de contado, lo que compra a mayoristas de mejor oferta en el mismo municipio donde habita. Su principal clientela son amas de casa y en general vecinos, que compran al detalle los artículos y productos, que requieren en su canasta familiar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual planea aumentar el surtido de su tienda, comprando productos con descuentos,de primera necesidad, arroz, aceite, carnes, salsas, azucar, leche etc  que la ayudan a tener un inventario con artículos y a manejar precios competitivos.
texts.en:
Emilse, 35, has a shop in the town of Puerto Colombia, located by the seashore, where she lives with her partner and their four children (ages 6 to 15). In January of 2011, her elderly father-in-law, who had devoted his life to the store, decided to give it to his son and Emilse to generate their livelihood.

In the shop she sells retail items like groceries, snacks, soda, meat, dairy, etc. The business is run by Emilse from 6 am to 9 pm every day, selling items on credit and more commonly in cash, which she buys wholesale at the best deals in the town where she lives. Her main customers are housewives and in general, neighbors, who buy retail items and products that they need for household consumption. 

She is currently requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she plans to increase the stock in her store, buying discounted products (staple items) like rice, oil, meat, sauces, sugar, milk, etc. that help her have an assorted inventory and to manage competitive prices.

loans.use: to buy discounted products (staple items): rice, oil, meat, sauces, sugar, milk.

loans.name: La Restauration 2 Group

texts.en:
Regis, age 33, is single with a 7-year-old daughter. She is currently attending school. He is representing the La Restauration 2 group.
