loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Vilma has been in this business for 10 years. Vilma earns more income from buying and selling 'nipa' (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction).

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 28 años , esta casada con Juan Carlos  y juntos tienen 2 pequeñas hijas , quienes son el motor de su vida .Isabel es propietaria de una vivienda construida con bloques de adobe en donde comparte sus vivencias familiares.Desde muy niña vive ligada a las actividades agrícolas y junto a su familia se dedicaban a la producción de cacao orgánico y desde que cumplió la mayoría de edad tiene la responsabilidad de mantener activa su parcela ,con el mantenimiento respectivo de las plantaciones de cacao, para el cual es necesario realizar las tareas del deshierbo y deschuponado de los árboles al día y logrando de esta manera obtener una producción de calidad.A manera de lograr agilizar el trabajo correspondiente desea contar con personal de apoyo como trabajadores del lugar razón por la cual acude a su entidad financiera y solicita un crédito para su capital.Dentro de sus planes a largo plazo estan la compra de un vehiculo para facilitar el transporte de sus productos a la ciudad logrando así disminuir los gastos de tranporte .En esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores y asi culminar con el deshierbo de maleza para obtener buenos granos de cacao.
texts.en:
Isabel is 28 years old. She is married to Juan Carlos and they have two young daughters, who are their reason for living.  Isabel is the owner of a dwelling built from adobe blocks where her family shares daily experiences. From a very young age her life has been tied to farming and, together with her family, she produces organic cacao. Since she became an adult she has had the responsibility of keeping her parcel of land under cultivation and of doing plantation maintenance where it is necessary to perform the tasks of weeding and pruning the trees in order to obtain quality cacao crops. In order to speed up the work involved, she wants to hire a local work force. Consequently she has approached Microfinanzas Prisma for a loan in order to have the necessary capital. 

Isabel has long range plans that include purchasing a vehicle to facilitate transport of her crops to the city, thus lowering her transport expenses. She currently needs S/. 1,000 in order to hire workers and finish weeding her fields so that she can reap good cacao beans.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
This is Jennelyn. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Jennelyn would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennelyn, just like any others who have businesses, dreams that her business will grow and expand. She hopes to give her family a good life. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Avelinda

texts.en:
Avelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Avelinda earns more income from buying and selling rice.

Avelinda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, spices, biscuits, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Avelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, spices, biscuits, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy feed and poultry. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She has been in this business for two years now and she sees a great opportunity so she is expanding it. Aside from breeding chickens, she also sells frozen foods and processed foods.

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy more poultry and feed for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Theresa dreams that her business will grow bigger and she will have more poultry. She hopes that her family will be prosperous. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and poultry needed in her business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 50 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, toothpaste, canned goods, spices, etc. Nelia has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future Nelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, toothpaste, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en:
Samrith is married with three children who attend school. She is currently employed in a garment factory in Reussey Keo district.  Her husband owns a motorbike for a transportation business. From a taxi stand, Samrith’s husband earns approximately $8.00 a day, from which they can cover their daily expenses and school fees for their children.

Samrith is requesting her second loan from HKL for $800, which she will use to purchase a motorcycle for her commute. This loan will help her avoid using other services and reduce her traveling costs. In the future, she hopes to work harder to create another business and supplement the family's income.

loans.use: o purchase a motorcycle for her commute.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 35 years old and a widow with six children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

Catalina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business.

Catalina has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business.

loans.name: Nelieta

texts.en:
Nelieta is 61 years old, married, and has eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Nelieta runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.

Nelieta is requesting a loan from NWTF for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stock to sell such as spices, noodles, milk, and cooking oil. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spices, noodles, milk, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 47 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years.

Noemi is requesting her tenth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and gasoline and pay for laborers' salaries of her farm. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and gasoline and pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin is 43 years old, residing with her family in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. She is a mother of three children who are currently attending local school in the province. She has been farming for more than 20 years to add to her husband’s income; he works in the construction field. Together, they can make around USD 11.00 per day to cover their family’s costs.

Sin had just paid off her previous loan with HKL before she applied for this loan. Sin will use the loan to purchase a piece of farmland for growing potatoes. With any remaining funds, she will cover wedding costs for her child whose wedding party is coming soon. This loan will help her to boost her profit and further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Ngem

texts.en:
Ngem, 60, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. Ngem does his daily routine as a motor taxi driver to generate an income for his family while his wife operates a grocery store from their own home.

Currently Ngem is asking for a loan to refill the inventory in his wife's store in order to make a sustainable business. He will buy soaps, shampoos, detergent powder, toiletries, sweets, snacks and other household miscellaneous items. This will be his seventh loan cycle with HKL as well as his third time with Kiva. He has never been late for any of his loans and has been a VIP client for HKL for using its financial services responsibly. He is very grateful for the loan granted to him in order to develop his income.

loans.use: to refill the inventory in his wife's store in order to make a sustainable business.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: Delphine est une femme de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans. Grâce à sa determination et à son dynamisme, elle a su fidéliser une bonne partie de son voisnage et augmenter graduellement cette clientèle au point où elle ressent le besoin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des produits (mèches et greffes : 10 pièces chacune, etc) afin satisfaire sa clientèle et ses prévisions de résultat. les bénéfices seront réintroduits dans son activité (capital mèches et greffes) et ouvrir une mini parfumerie d'une part et subviendront aux besoins familiaux (éducation, nutrition, logement) d'autre part
texts.en: Delphine is a 37-year old woman, married and the mother of three. She owns and manages a hairdresser’s salon in a local neighborhood and has been managing it for three years. Thanks to her determination and energy, she has been able to acquire a loyal customer following in her neighborhood and gradually increase this customer base to the point at which she needs to expand her merchandise stock. She would like to use this loan to stock up on products (hear extensions and grafts , 10 each, and so on) in order to meet her customers’ expectations. The revenues will be used to reinvest in her business (capital for hair extensions and grafts) and to open a small perfume shop and provide for family needs (education, nutrition, lodging).

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise [hair extensions etc].

loans.name: Danny Daniel

texts.es:
Danny es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Danny trabaja en las oficinas del MAGAP que es una empresa que se dedica a dar asesoramiento a los campecinos sobre la agricultura y ganaderia,  solicita el credtito para la comprar de bienes como lavadora, refrigeradora, y un microonda para la casa ya que los que poseen estan muy deteriorados.

El credito le ayudado a comprar las cosas de contado y comprar un poco mas baratos. El sueño de Danny ahorra dinero para poder salir de viaje a otro pais. en los tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Danny is single.  He doesn't have children and lives with his parents in Chimbo, Bolivar Province.  Danny works in the offices of MAGAP [Ecuadoran Ministry of Agriculture, Ranching, Aquaculture and Fisheries], which is a company that offers guidance to farmers in the areas of agriculture and cattle raising.

He is applying for a loan to buy property such as a washing machine, refrigerator, and a microwave for his house, since the ones they have are very dilapidated.  The loan will help him pay cash and buy things a bit cheaper.

Danny's dream is to save money to be able to travel to another country.  In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy property such as a washing machine, refrigerator and microwave.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 58 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Alicia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to pay the laborer's salary for her coconut farm.

Alicia has been farming coconuts for 10 years and also earns additional income from charcoal vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay the laborer's salary for her coconut farm

loans.name: Ovilla

texts.en:
This is Ovilla. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of raw products and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan, also to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. She also has a variety store and part of the loan will be used to buy grocery items to sell. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ovilla hopes to have a vehicle that she can use in her business and dreams that her children will finish their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw products like pork, chicken parts and other ingredients for her food vending.

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is 31 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Cherry Mae is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cherry Mae has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from direct selling of Avon products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is 59 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business farming ornamental plants in the Philippines. Cesaria requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and tools for her ornamental plant business.

Cesaria has been farming ornamental plants for seven years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cesaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and tools for her ornamental plant business

loans.name: Ines Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ines es soltera vive con los padres en casa de ellos vive en la ciudad de San juose de Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Ines se dedica a lavar  y planchar ropa de las personas que requieran de sus servicios. El credito solicita para la comprar de lavadoras nuevas y con mayor capacidad y television credito ha podido comprar lo necesario para aumentar la produccion y dar un buen servicio.

El sueño de Ines es ahorrar para poder construir la casa para los padres. En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a caminar con las amigas.
texts.en:
Irene is single. She lives with her parents in their house. She lives in the city of San Jose de Chimbo in the Bolivar Province.

Irene washes and irons clothes for people who need her services. She is applying for the loan to purchase new washers with greater capacity and a television.  With this loan she will be able to buy the necessary items to increase production and give better service.

Ines' dream is to save to be able to construct a house for her parents. In her free time she likes to go out to walk with friends.

loans.use: to purchase new washers and dryers with greater capacity, and a television

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 40 years old and has two children. Erlinda is married and has one child who is in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Erlinda has been buying and selling livestock for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 41 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to pay for the laborer's salary and to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evangeline has been farming sugarcane for three years. She earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for the laborer's salary and to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Hak, 38, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and two children, in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Hak makes a living in farming, and she also buys and resells dried clams with a little salt and spice, everywhere on the street in her neighborhood. Through her selling business, she is able to make approximately USD 5.00 per day, and she gets another income from her husband, who works in the construction industry.

This is Hak's third loan sequence with HKL. She plans to buy a cow for her farm, and she will breed it to produce a calf. She is requesting this loan because she doesn’t have enough capital to work out her plan. She believes that the loan funds will contribute to the development of her business and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her farm, which she will breed to produce a calf.

loans.name: Daung

texts.en:
Daung is 44 years old, married, and has one child.  She has a rice farming business.  Her income is barely enough to cover her daily costs as she has only a few small pieces of farmland. Her husband currently works at a construction site, earning $5.00 a day.

Daung is requesting her third loan from HKL, which she will use to purchase a passport for her husband who plans to work as a paid worker in Thailand. The remaining funds will be used for his traveling expenses. Daung and her husband believe that they can improve their income this way. She aspires to having a comfortable life and providing her only child a good education, so she must strive to work hard for his future.

loans.use: to purchase a passport for her husband who plans to work in a neighbor country.

loans.name: Dina Graciela

texts.es:
DINA  tiene 29 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con llos padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

DINA  se dedica a prestar servicios en una institución pública. Solicita el crédito para comprar una television y una cama de dos palzas Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar lo que necesita para adornar el dormirtorio.
 
Las compras las realizará en Guaranda.  El sueño es seguir mejorando la calidad de vida. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es luchar contra culquier enfermedad.

En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Dina Graciela is 29 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her parents in Chimbo, in Bolivar province.

Dina Graciela works providing services in a public institution. She is applying for the loan to buy a television and double bed. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she needs to furnish her room.

She makes her purchases in Guaranda. Her dream is to continue improving her quality of life. The challenge that she faces is to fight any illness.

In her free time, she likes to get together with her family.

loans.use: to buy a television and a new bed

loans.name: Manuel Eduardo

texts.es:
MANUEL  tiene 23 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívra.

MANUEL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a tocar en una banda de músicos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes, fungicidas, plaguicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar los insecticidas para trabajar en la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda cada mes.

El sueño es comprarce una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es mejorar la calidad de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer música.
texts.en:
Manuel Eduardo is 23 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in Chimbo, in the Bolivar province.

Manuel Eduardo works in agriculture, planting corn. In addition, he plays in a band of musicians.

He is applying for the loan to buy insecticides, fertilizers, fungicides, and pesticides. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy insecticides to work in agriculture. He will make his purchases in the city of Guaranda every month.

His dream is to buy a house. The challenge that he faces is to improve his quality of life. In his free time, he likes to play music.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, fungicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Ninfa Violeta

texts.es:
Ninfa es casada tiene 34 años vive con los hijos y con el esposo en Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, frejol, y papas. El credito le solicita para la compra de ferlitizantes, abonos, fungicidas y plaguicidas, el credito le ayudado para invertir en la agricultura.

Ninfa desea tener dinero para salir de viaje y conocer otras ciudades en los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con la familia y atender a los hijos.
texts.en:
Ninfa is 34 years old, she is married and she lives in Chimbo, Bolivar province, with her husband and their children.

She is a farmer and she plants corn, beans and potatoes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers, manure, fungicides and insecticides. Thanks to the loan she has been able to invest in her agriculture activity.

Ninfa wishes to earn enough money to go traveling and to visit other cities. In her free time she likes talking strolls with her family and caring for the children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, fungicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Tak

texts.en:
Tak is getting old, at her age of 62, but she is strong enough in physical work to continuously develop her farming. Tak wants to help all her children to live in a better lifestyle, through her efforts and sacrifices. Tak's photo was taken near a bicycle with a bamboo basket, from which her daughter operates her traveling sales business, selling foods, including vegetables and fish or meat. At the moment, Tak has only one child who relies on her income, while the other four already got married.

In order to give her family a comfortable situation, Tak has requested a loan of USD 1,000, to purchase a motorcycle for their transportation needs. Also, it can be used to provide a kind of taxi service to local people, for extra income. Tak appreciates all the help from Kiva lenders, and she is really confident to pay her loan back.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her family's transportation needs.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is married and works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling snack foods in the Philippines. 

Cristita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more snack foods to sell in her stall.

Cristita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build and expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Manuela su esposo es comerciante, ella no tiene hijos que mantener a todos les ha brindado lo que cabe dentro de sus posibilidades como madre con arduo trabajo para que ellos sean independientes, siempre con el apoyo de su esposo y su labor de policía desde hace muchos años, continua haciéndole mejoras a su hogar esta vez solicita un decimo crédito para la infraestructura del muro trasero de su casa para su seguridad y privacidad lo cual le es sumamente necesario, comprara cemento, arena, bloques, hierro y piedrines.
texts.en:
Manuela has worked hard to do everything she can as a mother so that her children will become independent. Her husband works as a vendor and a policeman. He has always supported her through the years, and with this support she has continued to make improvements to their home.

She is seeking her tenth loan so that she can build a wall behind her house for security and privacy, which is of utmost importance. She will use the loan funds to buy cement, sand, concrete blocks, stones and steel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, concrete blocks, stones and steel.

loans.name: Cela Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Cela es una clienta soltera, ella tiene una hija de quince años estudiante de primaria, Cela tiene un negocio de pulpería desde hace un año actualmente solicita su 2do crédito con Afodenic para la compra de 2 pacas de ropa usadas y vender a la par de su negocio de pulpería en donde ofertaría variedades de camisas, faldas, pantalones para jóvenes y adultos de esa manera aumentar un poco mas sus ganancias e ir creciendo poco a poco para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, gracias al apoyo de financiamiento.
texts.en: Doña Cela is a single client. She has one daughter, age fifteen, who is in elementary school. Celia has had a small store for one year and is currently requesting her second loan from Afodenic for the purchase of two packs of used clothing. She will sell it by the pair in her store where she offers a variety of shirts, skirts, and pants for youth and adults. This will increase her income a bit more and allow her to expand her business bit by bit. Her living conditions will improve thanks to this loan.

loans.use: to buy two packages of clothing.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en: Anderson is grateful for the previous loan and says it was of great help to his business and boosted it. He is requesting a loan amounting to Ksh. 40,000 to pay school fees for his children. He is grateful for the help from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance Trust.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 26-year-old with one child, a boy, nine years of age. She lives in Kisauni, Kenya in  a rented house with electricity and tap water. Her son has enrolled in school and therefore she has to work smart to provide for her son. She owns a charcoal stall.

She has requested a loan amounting to Ksh.10,000 to buy sacks of charcoal. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children with aged 10,13,15,17. She is  faithful person. She owns and operates a retail store where she sells household items. Her business is located at a busy and potential business area and her  primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the language barrier with customers who buy from her. She will use the ksh.30,000 loan to buy household  and utensil wheat flour and sacks of sugar to resale. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy household utensils, wheat flour and sacks of sugar to sell

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a 46-year-old married lady. She has children whose ages range from 15 years to 9 months old. She has been selling clothes in Mwambalasi, Kenya, her home town, for three years. Her major monthly expenditure is school fees  for her children.

She is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy bundles of clothes.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is from Samburu, Kenya. She is 34 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are still in school. They live in a solar-powered house in Samburu, Kenya.

Maria owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, potatoes, onions, detergents and snacks. She established her business three years ago. She has gained good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. She has now requested a loan of KSH 30,000 to buy sacks of onions and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina, a 38-year-old married mother of three children aged 15 and 12 years, describes herself as an optimistic and determined woman. She has operated a retail shop selling household items such as sugar, salt and cooking oil which has been operational for more than four years. Her enterprise is located in a residential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business.

She has approached for a loan amounting to 20,000 KES to buy sacks of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a 41 year-old hardworking entrepreneur.  He is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  He lives in a rental house. His major monthly expendidures are school fees and a rental fee.  He has a charcoal stall. His major difficulty for business expansion is lack of capital.
He seeks a loan amounting to ksh.30,000 to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. He is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is requesting another loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to add stock of wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She knows well that this will go hand in hand to improve her cafe business.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Fight For Shameness Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Fight For Shameness” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each group member in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Ramda is the featured leader of this group. Ramda is a 45-year-old widow with three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. 

Ramda sells rice, gari (food made out of cassava roots), soap, etc. With the help of this loan, Ramda is going to invest in her business. She will buy rice and gari in large quantity to add to her current stock. She will also use part of the loan to buy soap-making materials in order to produce a larger quantity of soap for sale.

(Also attached on the right of the photo is a borrower who was not present for a group snap shot).

loans.use: to buy rice and gari in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto, habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, hombre trabajador y luchador, su mayor sueño es tener mejores condiciones en su hogar, su esposa es comerciante y le apoya en todas sus decisiones, entre los dos busc an la manera de sacar adelante a sus hijos, con este nuevo credito podra darle un optimo mantenimiento a sus cultivos de piña, ya que comprara los insumos y fertilizantes tales como: Completo, Urea, Triple, etc. gracias a este mantenimiento su producto sera de calidad y la plaga no le producira ninguna perdida. Agradece el apoyo de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por estos años que le han dado confianza y respaldo.
texts.en: Roberto lives in the town of Ticuantepe. He is a resourceful and hardworking man whose biggest dream is to improve his living conditions. His wife is a retailer and she supports him with every decision, and they both look for ways to provide for their children; thanks to this new loan he will be able to give optimal care to his pineapple crops, as he will buy the supplies and different types of fertilizers.  Thanks to this loan his products will be high quality and he won't lose any of his crop to fungus. He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for their support and for having trusted and helped him in these past few years.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia, a 57-year-old married mother of five, is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to buy canned goods, candies, snack foods, vinegar and  spices because she is engaged in selling such products in the community of Ragan, in the province of Isabela. She hopes that her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, snack foods, vinegar and  spices for her store.

loans.name: Magna Elizabeth

texts.en:
Magna Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a Yacult vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

Magna Elizabeth requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of Yacult to sell.

She would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Yacult to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen is 39 years old and has a spouse. They live together in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Unfortunately, this couple doesn’t have any children, but they are hoping to have a child someday. 

Pen and her husband own and work on their farmland which they had received from their parents as their heritage after they were married. They have been working in this type of business for over ten years. To add more to her income, Pen makes and sells a kind of Khmer cake, adjacent to her house.

The loan she is asking for is to buy a motorcycle for use to support her household, so that they can either take it for business or for individual use. Another part of the loan will be used to repair the broken areas of her house. Pen mentioned that this loan will be very helpful in improving her living conditions. 

In the future, Pen hopes to work out plans and make her businesses achievable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for use to support her household.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom, a 32-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, resides in Samnak Tboung village, Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham where she operates two businesses to support her family: farming and selling recycled materials that she buys. She uses an old bicycle to collect the materials from house to house around her community, and she can earn an average of KHR 10,000 per day through the recycling business.

Yom is requesting a loan from HKL to buy construction materials for her husband, who has many customers. The loan will help make his a sustainable business. In the future, Yom wants to see her two children become professionals and have well-paying jobs.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her husband.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 55 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her husband and children, in their own house in Kompong Speu province. She works on a few pieces of farmland located very close to her house. Doing this work, she earns a small income for household expenses. She especially grows most of her harvest for food for the family's consumption, and she has been doing this for more than 30 years.

Kou is a very helpful mother for each of her children, whether they are married or single, employed or unemployed. As it will be her second loan cycle with HKL, Kou would like to purchase a motorcycle for home use, as well as to help her children in their traveling needs from day to day. She hopes the loan will be given, to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her family's use.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is a hard-working and honest man, who is married to a garment worker. Together, they reside in Dongkor district, Phnom Penh, and they are responsible for two children. Yem, age 38, devotes his time to working as a laborer in the construction industry. He normally gets his wage daily, approximately earning USD 5.00 per day.  His income usually goes for food, home bills, and other expenses. Traveling cost has been one of his expenses, as his family doesn’t own a vehicle for their necessities. In this regard, Yem is taking out a loan to purchase a motorcycle for household and business (commuting) use.

By using this loan to buy a motorcycle, Yem hopes to increase savings, for any future emergencies of his family. Yem expresses his appreciation to all kind lenders, who constantly support his family as well as others. He is sure that he will pay back the loan on time, following the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for household and work use.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 27-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has two children, 4 and 6 years old.  Both of them go to school.

Mary runs a clothes selling shop, and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2000 SSP to purchase clothes and other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Mary would like to expand her   business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Mary says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan   through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Ton lives together with his wife and their children, in a thatched house in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. He is 43 years old and is involved in agribusiness -- specifically, growing rice on his own paddy fields, twice a year. He has spent more than 20 years making improvements to his farming business and ensuring the overall welfare of his family. He has his wife, who always works alongside him, and together they can make around KHR 15,000 per day.

Ton has come to visit HKL for his first loan, part of which he will use to dig a well adjacent to his house, in order to get enough water for his family's daily consumption, such as drinking, cooking, and washing. The remaining funds he will use to build a bathroom, where the family will be protected when they are having a bath or using the toilet. He is very happy to have financial assistance from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to dig a well adjacent to his house, and to build a bathroom for family use.

loans.name: Deus Anderson

texts.es: Deus de 26 años de edad, comercializa mercancía en diversos municipios del departamento del Atlántico desde hace 7 años,  cuando desarrolló en compañía de su padre, el amor por el comercio, pues este se dedicaba a la actividad comercial también. Poco a poco Deus logró captar un mercado de clientes, en diversas poblaciones cercanas a su domicilio,  en las que hoy se encuentra posicionado. Los productos que Deus vende son las cortinas, las sabanas, colchas, poncheras, mangueras, almohadas, mediante la estrategia de crédito, a largo plazo, puerta a puerta y diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Su meta es lograr mas liquidez y expandirse a otros municipios, creando nuevas plazas de clientes, en las que pueda competir y desde ya está estudiando, el potencial de clientela en las poblaciones  en las que incursionará. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa de cama, artículos para el hogar en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado, para ganar descuentos y generar mayores utilidades que lo beneficiaran en su competitividad y harán de su credikiva una inversión exitosa..
texts.en: Deus is 26 years old and has been selling merchandise in different towns in the department of Atlántico for 7 years. He developed his love for business working alongside his father.  Little by little Deus attracted customers from different towns near his home and has positioned himself well. Deus sells products such as curtains, sheets, quilts, punch bowls, hoses and pillows on long term credit. He sells door to door everyday from 8:00 in the morning until 5:00 at night. His goal is to achieve more liquidity and expand to other towns to attract more customers. He is already studying his market potential in the towns he will venture into. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to purchase bedding and other household items in larger quantities than he normally does so he can get discounts and generate more profit which will make him more competitive and make the investment of his Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: purchase bedding and other household items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be an intelligent woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a suitable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the clothes retail business. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Prin

texts.en:
Prin is a resident of a Bak Thmenh village, of Kompong Speu province. He is 34 years old, married, and has two dependent children. His family’s primary occupation is crop cultivation. He grows vegetables, like cucumbers and pumpkins, in addition to rice. He has been in this type of business since he was single and lived with his parents. His income from farming is used mainly for food and other household expenses.

As of now, Prin has come to visit HKL for his first loan cycle, in order to renovate his old house. With the help of the loan, Prin will be able to provide his family a comfortable house in which to live. Prin aims to send his children to join a university, in the future.

loans.use: to renovate his old house.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang, age 43, is an industrious man and a loving father of three children. He currently lives in a peaceful village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. He owns and operates a few hectares of farmland to make a living and nourish his family. Aside from his hardships, Sang wants to give his family a better lifestyle and provide good opportunities for education to all his children. For a healthy living, Sang decided to build a bathroom inside, including  a toilet, for his household. Due to a shortage of funds, Sang would like to obtain a loan through HKL to buy materials needed to complete the unfinished parts of his bathroom. He believes that his situation will become better, with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to complete the unfinished parts of his bathroom.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Maria en su actividad comercial  le ha ido muy bien.  Con su credikiva anterior invertido en hacer mejoras en su local  y en comprar en mayor volumen materias primas e insumo, fortaleció su restaurante,   produciendo mayores ventas y más aun ingresos, porque Maria  al adecuar las instalaciones de su restaurante, lo arrendó y ahora recibe dinero por ese concepto de arriendo, el cual   invierte en mercancía y esto ha hecho crecer también su otro negocio; como está entusiasmada, una vez mas está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará Productos medicinales, sábanas, cubrelechos, ropa y electrodomésticos menores, encargados por sus mejores clientes para hacer que esta inversión sea muy exitosa..
texts.en:
Maria has done very well with her business. With her previous credikiva loan she invested in making improvements to her shop and buying ingredients and supplies in bulk. 

This way she built up her restaurant business, producing greater sales and even more income, because after she equipped the facilities of her restaurant, she rented it out and now receives money for rent, which she invests in merchandise. This has made her other business grow also.  

As she is enthusiastic, she is once again applying for a loan with which she will buy medicinal products, sheets, bedcovers, clothing and small electrical appliances ordered by her best customers. This will make this investment very successful.

loans.use: To buy medicinal products, sheets, bedcovers, clothing and small electrical appliances.

loans.name: Mnyanzi

texts.en: Mnyanzi, a 44-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Samburu Kenya where she has a clothing stall selling pants, blouses, and dresses, among other things. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Kshs. to buy bundles of dresses. She is grateful for this opportunity to improve her enterprise

loans.use: to buy bundles of dresses.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is 49 years old and lives in the village of Ragan, in Isabela province. She has three, adult-aged children. To provide for the basic needs of the family, she is engaged in hog raising. In able to expand it, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and additional pigs for her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional pigs for her business

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 56 years old, married, with six grown-up children. She is from the village of Ragan in the province of Isabela. She is engaged in selling barbecue and hot-dog sticks in front of her house. Merlita hopes that she can build a stall, so that she display her products well.

loans.use: to buy meat and spices for her business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina de 62 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y es madre de 4 hijos adultos, dos de los cuales habitan con ella; Desde hace 20 años, vende productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, y ha construido una clientela fija que durante todo este periodo le ha sido fiel y con ella ha logrado la sostenibilidad de su actividad. Carolina es experta en aprovechar oportunidades en el mercado cuando compra sus productos, pues principalmente adquiere los que se encuentran con descuentos especiales y que su revista promociona en cortos periodos. Con los buenos precios que obtiene logra una mayor rentabilidad y así mismo traslada a su clientela un buen servicio en oportunidad de adquirir productos que requieren con precios competitivos y respuesta inmediata. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cremas, colonias, perfumería y cosméticos. Con ello espera tener full sus inventaros y estar cada vez más oportuna en su respuesta al cliente, lo cual hace que su credikiva sea todo un éxito.
texts.en: Carolina is 62 years old and lives with her husband in the south part of the city.  She is the mother of four adult children, two of whom live with her.  For the past 20 years she has been selling products through specialized guides or catalogs and she has built steady customers that have been loyal and helped sustain her business.  Carolina is an expert in taking advantage of opportunities in the market when she buys her merchandise because she can find it with special discounts or promotions through her magazine for short periods.  With good prices, she can maximize her profits and is able to pass this onto her customers, along with good service and immediate response.  She is asking for this Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so she could buy creams, colognes, perfumes, and cosmetics.  She hopes to fill her inventories and be more prepared to respond to her customers.  This will make her Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Maria Yadira

texts.es:
La señora se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa desde hace 20 años, es soltera, madre de cinco hijos, dos dependen de ella, su negocio lo empezó con un dinero que le regalo una pariente los cuales fueron U$ 50.00, vendía ropa ambulante en los alrededores del bisne.

la señora se esfuerza por llevar el pan de cada día a su vivienda, es una señora que se esfuerza mucho, le gusta trabajar y salir adelante, labora desde las ocho y media de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde de lunes a sábado.

la señora solicita un financiamiento en ceprodel para surtir su negocio y aprovechas las ventas para obtener mejores ganancias, se siente muy agradecida ya que sin la oportunidad de este crédito le sería imposible lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
The borrower has been selling clothing for 20 years. She is single, and the mother of five children, two of whom depend on her. 

She started her business with some money a relative gave her, which was US$50. She sold clothing door-to-door in the area surrounding her business.

She does her best to support her household, and is a woman who works very hard. She likes to work and get ahead in life. She works from 8:30 in the morning to 5:00 in the afternoon, Monday to Saturday.

She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to stock her business and take advantage of the sales to get better earnings. She feels very grateful, as without the opportunity of this loan, it would be impossible for her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy children's and adult's underwear, shorts, hairclips, ponytail holders.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, vive con su familia, su esposa, sus hijos de las edades 12, 6, 3 y 1 años, estos dependen de él, el oficio de Juan lo realiza con la ayuda de su familia, su horario es de 7:00am a 2:00pm, lo realiza desde hace 15 años.
Él solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de los materiales para la agricultura, comprando semillas y abono, ya que su cultivo será en dos manzanas de terreno, esto le ayudara para mejorar la producción de la tierra.
Los sueños de Juan es poder tener una mejor estabilidad en su vida, superar los ingresos, darle a su familia lo necesario para la vida cotidiana.
texts.en:
Juan makes a living farming corn. He lives with his family. His wife and children, ages 1, 3, 6, and 12, depend on him. His family helps him with his work. His schedule is from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm, and he has been working for fifteen years.

He has applied for a loan to buy agricultural supplies, namely seeds and fertilizer. His crops will be on two blocks of land, which will help him to have better production from the land.

Juan's dreams are to have better stability in his life, to increase his earnings, and to give his family all that they need for their daily life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural medicine.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven is 44 years old and lives in a small village of Kompong Speu province. She is married and has four children. Farming is the sole source of her family’s income. Ven’s husband is doing the same type of business along with her on their farmland, which was inherited from her ancestors. However, the income is barely enough to cover their daily expenses. This causes Ven’s husband to get involved in other businesses outside of farming season. Also, some of their children are employed, to uplift their living standard out of poverty.

With the support from this loan, Ven will add to her personal savings in order to buy cement and other building materials, for building a room below her wooden house, where things can be kept for safety. She hopes that Kiva lenders will fund this loan, to better her living situation. For the further improvement of her farming business in the coming years, Ven plans to have a plowing machine, which will make her business more feasible and profitable.

loans.use: to buy building materials, for building a room below her wooden house

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by growing flowers in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 25 years.  She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Merly is requesting a loan from NWTF for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other materials for her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other materials for her flower business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira, vive con la familia, su esposo y dos hijos de 16 y 13 años de edad, administra una panadería, este negocio lo aprendió de la familia, lo atiende de 6:00am a 6:00pm, está instalado en su casa y todos le colaboran. 
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración del pan, como harina, azúcar, leche, levadura y otros que sean de utilidad para él, esto le ayudara para tener lo necesario y continuar en la panadería, le dará una mejor posibilidad de obtener ganancias, a sus clientes les ofrecerá un buen servicio.
La aspiración de Elvira es poder reconstruir su vivienda, con mejor calidad y hacer crecer la panadería.
texts.en:
Elvira lives with her family, made up of her husband and two children, ages 13 and 16. She runs a bakery. She learned about this business from her family. She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm. The bakery is located in her house, and everyone contributes to the business.

She has applied for a loan to buy ingredients to make bread, such as flour, sugar, milk, yeast, and other goods that will be useful to her. This will help her to have all that is necessary to continue with her bakery. The loan will give her a better chance to obtain an income. She will offer a good service to her clients. 

Elvira's aspiration is to be able to rebuild her home to improve its quality and to grow her bakery.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, yeast, and other goods.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, vive con la familia, con su esposa y dos hijos de 12 y 14 años de edad, solamente ellos dependen de él,  administran una tienda, lo aprendió de la familia, trabaja de lunes a domingo, su ventaja es que el negocio está instalado en la casa, lo realiza desde hace ocho años. 
José necesita invertir en el negocio, comprarse mercadería para surtir en variedad de pastas, pan, salsas, boquitas, jugos, entre otros productos, esto será un incremento en la mercadería y su tienda estará surtida para tener más ventas.
La aspiración de José es tener una mejor estabilidad de vida, mejores ingresos y así seguir trabajando por la familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his family. His wife and two children, ages 12 and 14, depend on him. He has been running a store for eight years. He learned about this business from his family. He works from Monday to Sunday. His advantage is that the business is located in his house.

José needs to invest in his business by buying merchandise to stock the store with a variety of types of pasta, bread, sauce, snacks, and juice, among other products. This will increase his merchandise and his business will be stocked in order to make more sales.

José's aspirations are to have better stability in his life, to have a better income, and to continue working for his family.

loans.use: to buy pasta, bread, sauce, snacks, and juice.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina obtained a loan before, and it was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more beverages, and the loan helped her to generate more income. She has two stores, and has run the business for five years, now. 

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 60,000 PHP, to buy different kinds of beverages. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina dreams of continuous success of her business, and hopes to have a vacation with her whole family. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members,* to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beverages and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia lives in the far area of theTumuini province of Isabela, in the village of Ragan.  To sustain the daily needs of her family, Ofelia sells frozen foods in the community. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional frozen meats and spices from a dealer. 

In the future, Ofelia hopes that her business will expand so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen meats and spices for her business.

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
Leliosa is 59 years old and has eight children. Leliosa is married and has one child who is in school.

Leliosa is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Leliosa requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy an additional pig to raise and buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Leliosa has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leliosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional pig to raise and buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing 11,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 62 years old and is married with six children of whom one child is in school. Amelita works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like spices, snack foods, noodles, milk, etc.

Amelita has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like spices, snack foods, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Ayra

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ayra works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from retailing rice. Ayra is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like soap, spices, toothpaste, noodles, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Ayra has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soap, spices, toothpaste, noodles and sugar.

loans.name: Anabell

texts.es: Anabell, 36 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León, de oficio costurera, madre de 2 hijos. Tiene más de 10 años  trabajando en la costura, realiza ropa para dama, caballeros y niños. Durante la temporada escolar sale en busca de clientes para ofrecer sus servicios y realizar los uniformes para la escuela y deportivos que es para lo cual utilizara el financiamiento pues necesita comprar tela, elástico, botones, hilos, zíper para elaborar uniformes.  Ella dice que una vez finalizado el pago de este crédito, desea seguir invirtiendo en la compra de más materia prima para trabajar y seguir ahorrando para darle sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Anabell, 36, is from the city of León. She is a seamstress and a mother to two children. She has been working in the sewing business for ten years and makes clothing for women, men, and children. During the school season, she searches for clients to whom she can offer her services by making school uniforms and sportswear. 

She will use this loan to buy fabric, elastic, buttons, thread, and zippers, which she needs to make uniforms. She says that once she has this loan, she would like to continue investing in the purchase of raw materials so that she can work and continue saving to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy fabric, elastic, buttons, thread, and zippers to make uniforms.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos de 6, 9 y 18 años respectivamente. Ella vive junto a su padre y a su tres hijos, se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa. La familia se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de pipían. 

Ella vive en un cerro, para comprar los insumos tiene que bajar el cerro caminando; por que no hay acceso de animales (caballo, burro) ni de vehículos. Al llegar al lugar en donde aborda el autobús, debe de viajar durante unos 24 kilómetros hasta llegar a la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas (formula, sulfato y pesticidas), pago de mano de obra para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y para comprar 10 tubos para el pozo, ya que tienen un motor prestado para sacar el agua. Con la inversión, podrán realizar sus trabajos a tiempo y seguros que no les faltara el alimento en su familia y podrán venderlo también; ya que tienen poco trabajo y por sus propios medios no lo pudieran lograr. Ella comenta, que en la zona donde vive se caracteriza por tener mucha demanda de cerdos; por lo que quiere dedicarse más tiempo a esta actividad.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old, married and has three children ages 6, 9 and 18. She lives with her father and three children and does all the household chores. Her family grows pipían [a squash variety] for a living. 
She lives on a hill and in order to buy supplies she has to walk down the hill because it is not accessible by animal or vehicle. She then has to take a bus for the 24 kilometer trip to the city. 
She is requesting a loan through Fundación Campo to buy agricultural supplies (sulfate and pesticides), labor to plant 7,000 square meters of corn and 10 well hoses to transport the water with a borrowed motor.  With the loan they will be able to get their work done on time and ensure that their family is fed.  They will also be able to sell some since they have little work and few resources. She says that in the region where she lives there is a high demand for pigs and she hopes to be able to dedicate more time to this activity.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies, pay for labor and well hoses to transport water.

loans.name: Angel Duval

texts.es:
Angel tiene 25 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Recinto TEMPLAZA perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TIEMPO DE CAMBIO se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Templaza pertence al Canton Pueblo Viejo  se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales como pollos, patos, gansos y  también cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas, además alimento para los animales balanceados de engorde y crianza. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es comprar terrenos  en los tiempos libres le gusta  hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angel is 25 years old; he is married and has children. He lives with his wife and their children in the Templaza neighborhood, which is a part of the Pueblo Viejo Canton, in the Province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the communal bank group "Tiempo de Cambio" (Time of Change) which is located in the neighborhood of Templaza, a part of Canton Pueblo Viejo. He makes a living working in agricultural and animal husbandry. 

Angel works in agriculture, planting crops of corn, and raising animals like chickens, ducks, geese, and pigs. With the loan he is requesting he will be able to buy supplies such as: fertilizers, insecticides (to protect from infestations) and feed for the animals he raises, to fatten them up. He makes his purchases in the city of Pueblo Viejo. 

His dream is to be able to buy land to continue planting crops. In his free time he likes to spend time with his family and play sports.

loans.use: abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas, además alimento para los animales balanceados de engorde y crianza.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un is 52 years old and married to a farmer. Together, they have been blessed with six children, four of whom started their own families and settled around their parents, in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. To make a livelihood, Un helps his wife manage their farm and also sells handmade brooms at the doorsteps of local people, or at public gathering areas, or at the markets. He uses his trailer for traveling sales, earning approximately KHR 15,000 per day.

Un would like to increase the volume of his sales, by adding more capital into his current business. However, he has a shortage of funds to make it possible; that’s why he is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva. He will use it to buy broom trees, and other raw materials, to make a huge production of brooms. With the increased income, Un plans to reinvest back into his business and cover his daily expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to buy broom trees, and other raw materials, to make a huge production of brooms to sell.

loans.name: Tuhtajon

texts.en:
Tuhtajon is 51 years old. She is the kind and lovely mother of two adult children, who are married with children of their own. Tuhtajon’s husband is a tractor-driver. He has a little income, so Tuhtajon’s family lives in poverty. She wants to buy some presents for her grandchildren  for the spring celebration of Navruz. 

Tuhtajon decided to start her own business, since she wants to find another source of income. She studied the course of ‘To get ahead’ from a woman's organization, and got enough skills about business. She wants to organize an animal husbandry business, as she has some experience with this.  

She has 1000 Somoni, and needs another 600 Somoni to buy four sheep to start the new business. She will manage her business well, as she is a hardworking and clever woman. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy four sheep to start a new business.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: This loan will help Maricris to buy more merchandise to expand her store. Maricris began her own store in front of her house three years ago to gain financially and to sustain the needs of her family. She manages the store with the help of her husband, and she hopes to expand the business to a second location in the future. She needs a loan to increase inventory and update the equipment in her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, nooddles and candies for her store.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 29 years old and has two children. Nena is married and has one child who is in school.

Nena is in the agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Nena has been buying and selling livestock for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 42 years old and has three children. Roselyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Roselyn has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mervin

texts.en:
Mervin is a hardworking and calm person. He got a high school degree, but was not able to continue his education in college, because ever since he was very young he has had to work. He is married and has three children, to whom he contributes financially and morally. 

He is now requesting a loan so that he can support  his family. He needs to repair the vehicle that he works with, as this activity provides his only source of work. He's been in this line of work for more than seven years. 

He states that the loan that he is requesting will also help him to achieve his greatest dream: to be able to have his own house in the future. This way he can improve his quality of life. He currently lives with his parents, who are a great support to him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and materials needed for his business.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en: Pinky, a 33-year-old married mother of four, is engaged in a motorcycle transport service managed by her husband. Pinky is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business. A very hardworking woman, she hopes to put up a store in front of their house in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben, who works hard to support his family, is married and has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 30 years now. He has requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials such as bamboo, a fishing net, etc. In the future, Ben would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like bamboo, a fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Las Chabelitas Group

texts.es:
“Las Chabelitas” es un grupo que se ubica en una comunidad muy tranquila las personas son muy amables platican que en el mes de febrero hay un carnaval donde toda la gente se divierte al máximo algunas de ellas participan en dicho Carnaval. El nombre del grupo lo eligió Don Mateo porque una de sus hijas se llama María Isabel y de cariño le dicen Chabelita. Son personas muy trabajadoras pero sobretodo muy alegres.

María Isabel, hija de Don Mateo también pertenece al grupo, platica que tiene 29 años en la actualidad vive en unión libre con el señor José Alejandro juntos han formado una familia con tres niños de los cuales van a la escuela. Isabel está solicitando un crédito para comprar ropa nueva como pantalón, suéteres, camisas, ropa para bebe, ropa para niños y niñas etc. Isabel lleva ya tres años con la actividad la inicio porque quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Isabel argumento “Mis niños eran muy pequeños y yo no podía conseguir un empleo ya que no podía dejar tanto tiempo a mis niños solos, así que para mí fue más fácil iniciar a vender ropa” Isabel platica que solo inicio con $500 pesos ahora está solicitando el crédito para poder comprar más ropa la cual la compra en Toluca, para después venderlas en las comunidades cercanas caminando, considera una muy buena manera de vender porque si puede tener más clientes, porque si solo se estableciera en un mismo lugar no tendría las mismas ganancias como las que está teniendo actualmente. Isabel cuenta que su única dificultad es cuando sus clientas se tardan mucho tiempo en pagarle y es cuando no salen muy bien sus ganancias pero de ahí en fuera nada grave, esto no la limita a tener grandes sueños como el que sus hijos terminen una carrera profesional donde puedan realizarse y tener una mejor calidad de vida, también le gustaría mejorar su vivienda para sentirse mas cómodos. Isabel y los integrantes del grupo están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA por el crédito otorgado porque al igual que Isabel ellos también podrán invertir en sus actividades como Don Mateo invertirá en su vulcanizadora, Ana Lilia invertirá en ropa y finalmente Sebastián en material para construcción.
texts.en:
The “Las Chabelitas” group is located in a calm community with very friendly people. They say that in the month of February, there is a carnival in which everyone has a lot of fun. Some of them participate in this carnival. Mateo chose the name of the group, because one of his daughters is named María Isabel and they affectionately call her Chabelita. The members are very hardworking people, but above all they are very happy.

María Isabel, Mateo's daughter, also belongs to the group. She is 28 years old and lives in a common law marriage with José Alejandro. Together they have started a family with their three children, who go to school. Isabel has applied for this loan to buy new clothing, such as pants, sweaters, shirts, clothing for babies and children, etc. She has already been in this business for three years, because she wanted to help her husband with their household expenses. Isabel says, "My children were very young and I was unable to work because I couldn't leave them alone for a long time, so it was easier for me to start selling clothing." Isabel says that she started her business with only 500 pesos.

She has applied for this loan to buy more clothing in Toluca, which she will then sell by walking around the surrounding communities. She considers this a very good way to make sales because she can have more clients. If she only established herself in one place, she would not have the same income that she currently has. Isabel says that her only difficulty arises when her clients take a long time to pay her, and when her income is not very good. However, this has not been serious and it has not kept her from having big dreams, such as her children finishing a professional degree so that they can fulfill themselves and have a better quality of life. She would also like to make improvements to her home so that the family is more comfortable.

Isabel and the group members are very happy and grateful to VisionFund and Kiva for this loan. Like Isabel, they will be able to invest in their businesses. Mateo will invest in his tire repair shop, Ana Lilia will invest in clothing, and Sebastián will invest in construction materials.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as sweatpants, shirts, trousers, skirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 75 years old.  She is a widow and she has seven children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelina runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in business for 23 years.  She has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock to sell including canned goods, soap, shampoo and eggs.

In the future, Carmelina would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell including canned goods, soap, shampoo and eggs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family.  Edna is married and has a business buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines.

Edna has been in this business for one year now.  Edna has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional pieces of jewelry to sell.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pieces of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Brenda Alicia

texts.es:
Brenda tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos varones; uno de cuatro y otro de siete años de edad.  Vive junto a su mamá y sus dos hermanos. La familia se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, desde hace unos 15 años; los abuelos de Brenda les heredaron un terreno en donde ellos pudieran cultivar y en la crianza de cerdos tienen unos tres años de estar desempeñándola. 

Ella vive en un cerro, para comprar los insumos tiene que bajar el cerro caminando; por que no hay acceso de animales (caballo, burro) ni de vehículos. Al llegar al lugar en donde aborda el autobús, debe de viajar durante unos 24 kilómetros hasta llegar a la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas (formula, sulfato y pesticidas) para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, la semilla a utilizar para la siembra es la de la cosecha anterior. Al contar con el dinero para cultivar, esperaría que el precio del maíz tenga buen precio, ya que por el momento no ha vendido el de la cosecha anterior porque el precio de venta es bastante bajo y tiene que esperar a que mejore y con el préstamo no perdería tiempo y podrá realizar la cosecha de este año. Ella comenta, que además de realizar trabajos agrícolas también le gustaría criar en mayor cantidad cerdos, por lo menos unos ocho.
texts.en:
Brenda is a 29-year old woman and single mother of two boys, aged 4 and 7.
